summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum dated July 23, 2019, reporting an interview with inmate Nichols Tartaglione regarding an incident with his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein. Tartaglione describes waking to find Epstein staring at him in their cell, prompting him to call for staff assistance.

persons.name: Nichols Tartaglione
persons.context: A pre-trial inmate housed in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. He was interviewed regarding an incident involving his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The accused financier and sex offender, identified as the cellmate of Nichols Tartaglione. The document reports an incident where Tartaglione woke to find Epstein staring at him.

connections.description: Were housed together in the same cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, as reported in this incident memorandum.

events.title: Interview Regarding Cell Incident
events.description: An interview was conducted with inmate Nichols Tartaglione regarding an incident that occurred with his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein. Tartaglione reported waking to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him.

events.title: Cell Incident with Epstein
events.description: Inmate Nichols Tartaglione reported that past midnight, he woke up after feeling something hit his foot and observed his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein, sitting on the ground staring at him without responding to questions.

events.title: Tartaglione's Last Disciplinary Incident
events.description: Nichols Tartaglione's last recorded incident report was for fighting with another inmate.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, as of July 23, 2019.
Epstein's cellmate was Nichols Tartaglione, a pre-trial inmate facing murder and drug conspiracy charges.
An incident occurred where Tartaglione woke to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, leading Tartaglione to call for staff assistance.
The document is a Bureau of Prisons internal memorandum, indicating official monitoring of inmate interactions and incidents.
The document's date (July 23, 2019) places this incident approximately two weeks before Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
